title: Mango Chutney
ingredients: 6 large mangos; peeled, slice and diced
¼ pound crystallized ginger, finely chopped
instructions: In a large pot combine the mangos, dates, sugar, raisins, ginger, garlic, salt and the cayenne pepper.  Stir in the vinegar and bring the mixture to a boil over high heat; when the mixture reaches a moderate boil reduce the heat to medium.  Simmer the mixture at the medium heat setting, stirring frequently, until it thickens; which should be about 30 minutes.
Pour the chutney into 8-ounce sterilized Mason jars and seal.

Remarks:  “Chutney” comes from the East Indian word “chatni” and describes a sweet-and-sour condiment containing fruits, vegetables, sugar, spices, and vinegar.  Chutneys range in spiciness from mild to hot.

Source:  The Colonial Williamsburg Tavern Cookbook, by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, Recipes Developed by John R. Gonzales, Edited by Charles Pierce, Clarkson Potter/Publishers, New York, © 2001 by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.
